name: B. Square
statement:
There is a square painted on a piece of paper, the square’s side equals
meters. John Doe draws crosses on the square’s perimeter. John paints
the first cross in the lower left corner of the square. Then John moves
along the square’s perimeter in the clockwise direction (first upwards,
then to the right, then downwards, then to the left and so on). Every
time he walks meters, he draws a cross (see picture for
clarifications).John Doe stops only when the lower left corner of the
square has two crosses. How many crosses will John draw?
